Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: 2D layered structure with intralayer and interlayer channels

Other Information.Additional Info: Methane molecules move freely through the interlayer channels.
Ethane molecules move freely through the interlayer channels but exhibit slower diffusion compared to methane.
Propane is restricted by its large molecular size in the interlayer channels, leading to significantly slower diffusion.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion at sub-nanometer scale combined with kinetic effects

Experimental Validation.Method: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction, breakthrough experiments, CBMC simulations, DFT-D calculations, MD simulations
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: C2H6/C3H8 equilibrium-kinetic combined selectivity: 1.4, C2H6/C3H8 dynamic separation factor: 1.2

Other Information.Additional Info: The material exhibits high affinity for propane but slower diffusion, enabling selective capture of ethane from a mixture of methane, ethane, and propane.
